result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Eddie C Fair

records.addlTxt: Notice of hearing sent 10-3-22 to defendant returned "insufficient address, unable to forward."

2:05 PM Defendant Eddie C Fair in court.  Attorney Robert Buckett in court for Eddie C Fair. Cheryl Schmidt appears under SCR 50 WI statutes.
Further proceedings scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Further proceedings on November 16, 2022 at 10:00 am.
(1:14 pm) Def called COC's office indicating will be late, arriving approximately at 2 pm.  Email sent to clerk and to atty Buckett.

1:52 PM . Defendant Eddie C Fair in court.  Attorney Robert Buckett in court for Eddie C Fair. Atty. Benjamin Lindsay appears for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Buckett has received discovery. He has a pretrial on 9/9/2022.
Further proceedings scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Further proceedings on October 3, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
8:15 a.m. Def called COC office requesting to appear by Zoom. Clerk advised he must contact his atty to make request with the Court.
Further proceedings on August 24, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Due to a calendar conflict, Court rescheduled case to 8/24.
Def's notice of hrg for 7/21 returned as "insufficient address, unable to forward".  Email sent to counsel to confirm address.

records.addlTxt:
11:44 AM Defendant Eddie C Fair in court.  Attorney Robert Buckett in court for Eddie C Fair. Atty. Benjamin Lindsay appears for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Court examines defendant, accepts waiver and binds case over for trial. State files information. Defense waives reading and enters not guilty plea. State files information. Defense waives reading and enters not guilty plea.
Further proceedings scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Further proceedings on July 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.

8:36 AM Defendant Eddie C Fair in court.  Attorney Antonella Aleman Zientak in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant advised of complaint/penalties thereof. Defendant has contacted the Public Defender's office and qualifies. Court finds good cause for extending time limits for preliminary hearing.
Further proceedings scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Further proceedings on June 6, 2022 at 10:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Eddie C Fair
Current: 1331 W National Ave, Milwaukee, WI 53204 53204  (Effective: 03-21-2022)
Prior: 120 E National Ave,219, Milwaukee, WI 53204
Notice of hearing sent to defendant returned as "attempted - not known"

2:47 PM Prosecuting attorney Adam Yale Gerol in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Eddie C Fair in court. Court reviews charges/penalties and right to counsel. Defendant wishes to represent himself. Court orally examines defendant for Waiver of Right to Atty and accepts waiver.
Further proceedings scheduled for May 2, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Further proceedings on May 2, 2022 at 08:15 am.
22R 003273  Bond posted at Sheriff's Office on 3/23/2022.

No contact with: Uhaul Corporation/stores or representatives. Absolute sobriety.  No THC products. No possession/consumption of any intoxicants. No controlled substance or prescription medication unless prescribed by physician and in conformity with said prescription. Prescription must remain in original container. No possession of drug paraphernalia.

1:24 PM Defendant Eddie C Fair appeared by video in custody of the Ozaukee County Jail and by Atty. Heather Dvoran. Attorney Matthew Vincent Nugent for State of Wisconsin appeared in court. Atty. Dvoran appears as friend of the Court, doesn't qualify for PD. Defendant advised of complaint/penalties thereof. State recommends $5000 cash bail w/conditions. Court orders $2000 cash bail w/conditions. Court finds good cause for not setting preliminary hearing. Court finds probable cause.
Status hearing scheduled for March 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
